tweet: Deeply saddened by the passing of Henry County Police Officer Michael Smith. Dee Dee & I are lifting his family, his fellow officers at the department, & his comrades across the country up in prayer. To all those who are risking your lives every day to keep us safe, thank you. https://twitter.com/HenryCoPolice/status/1078652352599597056 …

Wishing all of #GA10 a blessed and #MerryChristmas. May the true light of Christ illuminate your lives. Isaiah 9:6

COMING UP NOW: @CongressmanHice & @RepTomGarrett on @FoxNews to discuss the #BorderWall, #SpendingBill, and @HouseGOP fulfilling its promise to #BuildTheWall. pic.twitter.com/sEfQiOrYJL

I’m proud @GovernorDeal, the State of Georgia, and @RepDougCollins have served as vanguards for criminal justice reform and helped work the #FirstStepAct through the federal level to emulate our state’s record of achievement. Today is a win for both redemption and public safety.

With the passage of S. 756, the #FirstStepAct, we are taking important action in reforming our criminal justice system while saving taxpayer dollars and ensuring second chances for those who rehabilitate and re-enter society through training and skill development. https://twitter.com/RepDougCollins/status/1075829426242359296 …

Speaking with @toddstarnes at 2:05 p.m. to discuss the #BorderWall, #SpendingBill, and how the @freedomcaucus stands with millions of Americans who want to #BuildTheWall on @foxnewsradio. Listen in live here:  https://radio.foxnews.com/listen/listen-live-2/ …. https://twitter.com/toddstarnes/status/1075799473819934720 …

We get what we deserve when we don't #DoWhatWeSaid. The border crisis is real, and while the #BorderWall cannot be the only part of the immigration solution, it plays an indisputably critical part…because walls work! The @freedomcaucus knows that and so do the American people. pic.twitter.com/l4TWw05Wz8

My D.C. office might have changed, but our southern hospitality hasn't! #GA10's home in our Nation's capital is now located at 409 Cannon House Office Building. Come on by and say “hi” to #TeamHice while you enjoy some Georgia peanuts and a cold Coke next time you're in town. pic.twitter.com/6aN3Wkj7Vw

Glad to be back in #GA10 for a few days after a busy week on Capitol Hill. Productive meeting this morning in Greene County. This Christmas season, many members of our military will spend the holidays away from their families and loved ones. Today, we’re celebrating 200 years of an outstanding community and fantastic place to live, work, and raise a family. From Dacula to Lawrenceville to Buford, I’m honored to represent folks from Gwinnett County. Happy Birthday, Gwinnett, and here's to next 200! #GA10 pic.twitter.com/lTg551VK6Y

Today, America's oldest military force turns 382. Members of the National & @GeorgiaGuard come from every walk of life & work in every industry, but come together to serve our Nation & communities. Better roads are coming our way! Last week, the @USDOT awarded Georgia a $24.8 million BUILD grant to assist with highway improvements in Barrow Co., including the widening of Highway 316 as we continue to build along this critical corridor. #GA10

On Saturday, one of my Service Academy nominees, Anna Jerald, had the opportunity to meet and speak with @SecPompeo during the 119th #ArmyNavyGame. Now a “yearling” at @WestPoint_USMA, her drive and motivation to serve our Nation are making us proud. Keep it up, Anna! #GA10 pic.twitter.com/OrHZ8nNFiE

President Bush was a remarkable leader who led a life of duty, purpose, and conviction. It was amazing to see our country come together last week to mourn his legacy of leadership, love of country, and dedication to family. Just spoke on the @HouseFloor in support of my bill, H.R. 6108, the Preserving America’s Battlefields Act, a bill to reauthorize a successful dollar-for-dollar grants program that promotes the preservation of historic battlefields like Kettle Creek in Wilkes County. #GA10 pic.twitter.com/XYJJAIU8RA

After 77 years, we have not forgotten those servicemembers and innocent souls who died in the attacks on #PearlHarbor. Today, let’s remember the brave men and women who have given their lives in service to our Nation during World War II and throughout our history.  #PearlHarbor77 https://twitter.com/USArmy/status/1071030885292462080 …

One year ago, @POTUS @realDonaldTrump announced that the U.S. officially recognized Jerusalem as the capital of Israel. Today, I’m proud to celebrate the anniversary, and I look forward to continuing to strengthen the enduring ties between our two nations. https://blogs.timesofisrael.com/the-day-president-trump-announced-the-us-embassy-move-to-jerusalem/ …

If you are in the Washington, D.C. area and would like to pay your respects to #Bush41, the U.S. Capitol Rotunda will be open to the public via the Capitol Visitor Center from Monday, December 3, 2018 at 7:30 p.m. until 7:00 a.m. on Wednesday, December 5, 2018. #Remembering41 https://twitter.com/SpeakerRyan/status/1069709445524058112 …
Wishing a happy and joyous first night of #Hanukkah! May all of my Jewish friends and those observing around the world find peace, love, and light this holiday season. #HappyHanukkah

Dee Dee and I send our deepest condolences to the Bush family and to all of those mourning our beloved 41st President. Godspeed, H.W. #Bush41 https://www.nbcnews.com/slideshow/george-h-w-bush-look-back-former-president-s-life-n708561 …

We mourn the loss of a great American and will long remember his life of service and the legacy he leaves behind. Undoubtedly, his example will continue to inspire all Americans to serve a greater cause.
With President George H.W. Bush’s passing, we have lost one of the all-time greats, an incomparable and irreplaceable public servant whose dedication and grace embodied duty, honor, and country.
